checkAccountMaxBuySize(uint32,uint256,ui.details: Rule checks if recipient balance + amount exceeded purchaseAmount during purchase period, prevent purchases for freeze period

params.amount: Number of tokens to be transferred
params.boughtInPeriod: Number of tokens bought during Period
params.lastUpdateTime: block.timestamp of most recent transaction from sender.
params.toTags: Account tags applied to sender via App Manager

returns._0: cumulativeTotal total amount of tokens bought within buy period.

checkAccountMaxSellSize(uint32,uint256,u.details: Sell rule functions similar to account max buy size rule but "resets" at 12 utc after maxSize is exceeded

params.amount: Number of tokens to be transferred
params.fromTags: Account tags applied to sender via App Manager
params.lastUpdateTime: block.timestamp of most recent transaction from sender.

returns._0: cumulativeSales Total tokens sold within sell period.

checkAccountMaxTokenBalance(uint256,byte.details: Check if tagged account passes AccountMaxTokenBalance rule

params.amount: Number of tokens to be transferred
params.balanceTo: Number of tokens held by recipient address
params.toTags: Account tags applied to recipient via App Manager

checkAccountMinMaxTokenBalance(uint32,ui.details: Check the min/max token balance rule. This rule ensures that both the to and from accounts do not exceed the max balance or go below the min balance.

params.amount: total number of tokens to be transferred
params.balanceFrom: Token balance of the sender address
params.balanceTo: Token balance of the recipient address
params.fromTags: tags applied via App Manager to sender address
params.ruleId: Uint value of the ruleId storage pointer for applicable rule.
params.toTags: tags applied via App Manager to recipient address

checkAccountMinMaxTokenBalanceAMM(uint32.details: Check the min/max token balance rule through the AMM Swap

params.amountIn: total number of tokens to be swapped
params.amountOut: total number of tokens to be received
params.fromTags: tags applied via App Manager to sender address
params.ruleIdToken0: Uint value of the ruleId storage pointer for applicable rule.
params.ruleIdToken1: Uint value of the ruleId storage pointer for applicable rule.
params.tokenBalance0: Token balance of the token being swapped
params.tokenBalance1: Token balance of the received token

checkAccountMinTokenBalance(uint256,byte.details: Check if tagged account passes AccountMinTokenBalance rule

params.amount: Number of tokens to be transferred
params.balanceFrom: Number of tokens held by sender address
params.fromTags: Account tags applied to sender via App Manager

checkAdminMinTokenBalance(uint32,uint256.details: Checks that an admin won't hold less tokens than promised until a certain date

params.amount: Number of tokens to be transferred
params.currentBalance: of tokens held by the admin

getAccountMaxBuySizeStart(uint32).details: Function get the account max buy size rule start timestamp

getAccountMaxSellSize(uint32,bytes32).details: Function to get Sell rule at index

getAccountMaxSellSizeStartByIndex(uint32.details: Function get the account max buy size rule start timestamp

getAccountMinMaxTokenBalanceStart(uint32.details: Function get the min/max rule start timestamp

getAdminMinTokenBalance(uint32).details: Function gets AdminMinTokenBalance rule at index

getTotalAccountMaxSellSize().details: Function to get total Sell rules

getTotalAdminMinTokenBalance().details: Function to get total AdminMinTokenBalance rules

checkAccountMaxBuySize(uint32,uint256,ui.notice: If the rule applies to all users, it checks blank tag only. Otherwise loop through  tags and check for specific application. This was done in a minimal way to allow for   modifications later while not duplicating rule check logic.

checkAccountMaxTokenBalance(uint256,byte.notice: If the rule applies to all users, it checks blank tag only. Otherwise loop through    tags and check for specific application. This was done in a minimal way to allow for    modifications later while not duplicating rule check logic.

checkAccountMinTokenBalance(uint256,byte.notice: If the rule applies to all users, it checks blank tag only. Otherwise loop through  tags and check for specific application. This was done in a minimal way to allow for   modifications later while not duplicating rule check logic.

checkAdminMinTokenBalance(uint32,uint256.notice: that the function will revert if the check finds a violation of the rule, but won't give anything back if everything checks out.
